org.cougaar.util
Class LRUExpireMap

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      java.util.HashMap<K,V>
          java.util.LinkedHashMap
              org.cougaar.util.LRUExpireMap
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Map
public class LRUExpireMap
extends java.util.LinkedHashMap

An LRUExpireMap is a simple least-recently-used cache that also expires entries based on the system time.

Entries are put in the map with an explicit expiration time. The cache will not return expired entries and will remove them automatically. The cache also has a maximum size to limit the number of non-expired entries.

The caller must synchronized access on this map.

If you just want a simple LRU cache then see the javadocs for LinkedHashMap, where you can override the "removeEldestEntry(..)" method.

See Also:

get

Specified by:

Overrides:

get

public java.lang.Object get(java.lang.Object key,
                            boolean bypass)
Get a value with an optional "bypass the cache" flag".

The config's "minBypassTime()" is consulted if the entry has not expired. This allows the config to limit the bypass to a fixed time from the "put(..)" of the entry (e.g. "you can only bypass if the entry is older than 5 seconds").

Returns:
the value

getExpirationTime

public long getExpirationTime(java.lang.Object key)
Get the expiration time for an entry.

Returns:
-1 if the entry is not in the cache or has expired.

put in interface java.util.Map
Overrides:
put in class java.util.HashMap
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Must specify an expiration time

put

public java.lang.Object put(java.lang.Object key,
                            java.lang.Object value,
                            long expireTime)
Put an entry in the cache with an expiration time.

If it has already expired, this is method removes the old value (even if it hasn't expired) and ignores the new value.

Returns:
the old value if one was replaced

removeEldestEntry

protected boolean removeEldestEntry(java.util.Map.Entry eldest)
Called by the LinkedHashMap when an entry is added, this allows the cache to remove the LRU "eldest" entry.

Overrides:
removeEldestEntry in class java.util.LinkedHashMap

trim

public boolean trim()
Remove all expired entries from the cache.

This can optionally be called on a periodic timer, but it's not necessary -- the cache will limit its size based upon the config's "maxSize()".

Returns:
true if anything was removed
